abstract: An annotation in a PDF document.
overview:
## Overview

In addition to its primary textual content, a PDF file can contain annotations that represent links, form elements, highlighting circles, textual notes, and so on. Each annotation has a specific location on a page and may offer interactivity with the user.

source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/pdfkit/pdfannotation

# PDFAnnotation

**Class**

An annotation in a PDF document.

## Declaration

```swift
class PDFAnnotation
```

## Overview

In addition to its primary textual content, a PDF file can contain annotations that represent links, form elements, highlighting circles, textual notes, and so on. Each annotation has a specific location on a page and may offer interactivity with the user.

## Creating an Annotation

- **init(bounds:forType:withProperties:)**: Creates a PDF annotation with the specified bounds, type, and optional properties.
- **PDFAnnotationSubtype**: The type of annotation, such as circle, text, or ink.

## Accessing Information About an Annotation

- **page**: Returns the page that the annotation is associated with.
- **modificationDate**: Returns the modification date of the annotation.
- **userName**: Returns the name of the user who created the annotation.
- **type**: Returns the type of the annotation.
- **action**: An object that represents an action for a PDF element, such as a link annotation.
- **PDFAction**: An action that is performed when, for example, a PDF annotation is activated or an outline item is clicked.
- **PDFDestination**: A `PDFDestination` object describes a point on a PDF page.

## Managing Annotation Drawing and Output

- **draw(with:in:)**: Draws the annotation in a graphics context using page-space coordinates relative to the origin of the specified box.
- **shouldDisplay**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the annotation should be displayed.
- **shouldPrint**: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the annotation should appear when the document is printed.

## Modifying Annotation Attributes

- **annotationKeyValues**: A dictionary that contains a deep copy of the widget’s properties.
- **value(forAnnotationKey:)**: Returns a deep copy of the key-value pairs of properties for the specified key.
- **setValue(_:forAnnotationKey:)**: Sets a value in the annotation’s dictionary.
- **setBoolean(_:forAnnotationKey:)**: Sets a Boolean value in the annotation’s dictionary.
- **setRect(_:forAnnotationKey:)**: Sets a rectangle value in the annotation’s dictionary.
- **removeValue(forAnnotationKey:)**: Removes a value from the annotation’s dictionary.
- **PDFAnnotationKey**: Keys for setting properties of annotations.

## Managing Annotation Display Characteristics

- **alignment**: The alignment of the free text and text widget annotation’s text content.
- **bounds**: Returns the bounding box for the annotation in page space.
- **contents**: Returns the textual content (if any) associated with the annotation.
- **font**: The font the annotation uses to display text.
- **fontColor**: The font color the annotation uses to display text.
- **border**: Sets the border style for the annotation.
- **PDFBorder**: An optional border for an annotation that lies completely within the annotation rectangle.
- **isHighlighted**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the annotation is in a highlighted state, such as when the mouse is down on a link annotation.
- **color**: Sets the stroke color for the annotation.
- **hasAppearanceStream**: Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether the annotation has an appearance stream associated with it.

## Configuring Shape Annotations

- **interiorColor**: The fill color for drawing a circle, line, or square annotation.

## Configuring Line Annotations

- **startPoint**: The point where a line begins, in annotation-space coordinates.
- **endPoint**: The point where a line ends, in annotation-space coordinates.
- **startLineStyle**: The style of the line annotation’s starting point, such as square or filled arrowhead.
- **endLineStyle**: The style of the line annotation’s ending point, such as square or filled arrowhead.
- **lineStyle(fromName:)**: Returns a line style that corresponds to the specified name.
- **name(for:)**: Returns the name of the line style, which matches the definition in the Adobe PDF Specification.

## Configuring Link Annotations

- **destination**: The destination for a link annotation.
- **url**: A URL for a link annotation.

## Configuring Text Annotations

- **iconType**: The type of icon to display for a pop-up text annotation.
- **PDFTextAnnotationIconType**: The types of icons that a text annotation can use.
- **PDFAnnotationTextIconType**: Constants for icon type values in text annotation property dictionaries.

## Configuring Pop-Up Annotations

- **popup**: Returns the pop-up annotation associated with an annotation.
- **isOpen**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the pop-up annotation is in an opened state, displaying its text content, or in a closed state, displaying an icon.

## Configuring Text Markup Annotations

- **markupType**: The markup type that the annotation displays, either highlight, strikethrough, underline, or redact.
- **PDFMarkupType**: The styles available for markup annotations in PDFKit.
- **quadrilateralPoints**: An array of values that represents the points bounding the marked-up text.

## Configuring Widget Annotations

- **widgetFieldType**: The type of widget annotation, such as button, choice, or text.
- **widgetStringValue**: The string value of the widget annotation.
- **widgetDefaultStringValue**: The string value that the widget reverts to when performing a reset form action.
- **fieldName**: The widget identifier for form annotation actions and behaviors.
- **backgroundColor**: The color of the widget’s background.
- **isReadOnly**: A Boolean value that determines whether the widget is editable.
- **PDFWidgetControlType**: The types of annotation buttons.
- **PDFAppearanceCharacteristics**: An object that represents appearance characteristics of a widget annotation.

## Configuring Text Widget Annotations

- **isMultiline**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the text widget annotation displays multiple lines.
- **isPasswordField**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the text widget annotation displays a password field using bullet characters.
- **maximumLength**: The maximum number of characters the text widget annotation allows.
- **hasComb**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the annotation divides the text widget’s bounds into equally spaced segments, such as in a form entry field.

## Configuring Button Widget Annotations

- **widgetControlType**: The type of button widget control, either radio button, push button, or checkbox.
- **buttonWidgetState**: The current state of the button widget annotation.
- **PDFWidgetCellState**: The state of a button annotation, either on, off, or mixed.
- **buttonWidgetStateString**: A string value that differentiates button widgets in the same group, such as to identify mutually exclusive radio buttons from each other.
- **caption**: The title of push button widget annotations.
- **allowsToggleToOff**: A Boolean value that indicates whether clicking or tapping a selected radio button toggles it to an unselected state.
- **radiosInUnison**: A Boolean value that indicates whether radio buttons in a group turn on and off in unison.

## Configuring Choice Widget Annotations

- **choices**: An array of strings that specifies the options in either a list or a pop-up menu.
- **isListChoice**: A Boolean value that indicates whether the choice widget annotation is a list or a pop-up menu.
- **values**: An array of strings that specifies the export values for items in a list or a pop-up menu.

## Configuring Ink Annotations

- **paths**: An array of bezier paths, in annotation-space coordinates, that compose the annotation.
- **add(_:)**: Adds a bezier path to the ink annotation.
- **remove(_:)**: Removes a bezier path from an ink annotation.

## Configuring Stamp Annotations

- **stampName**: The name of the stamp, a text or graphics annotation that emulates a rubber stamp effect.

## Deprecated

- **Deprecated Symbols**: Review unsupported symbols and their replacements.

## Instance Properties

- **isActivatableTextField**

## Annotations

- **Adding Widgets to a PDF Document**: Add text, button, and choice widgets to a PDF document.
- **Adding Custom Graphics to a PDF**: Create and add custom annotation and page graphics to your PDF document.
- **Custom Graphics**: Demonstrates adding a watermark to a PDF page.
- **PDF Widgets**: Demonstrates adding widgets—interactive form elements—to a PDF document.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Inherited By

- PDFAnnotationButtonWidget
- PDFAnnotationChoiceWidget
- PDFAnnotationCircle
- PDFAnnotationFreeText
- PDFAnnotationInk
- PDFAnnotationLine
- PDFAnnotationLink
- PDFAnnotationMarkup
- PDFAnnotationPopup
- PDFAnnotationSquare
- PDFAnnotationStamp
- PDFAnnotationText
- PDFAnnotationTextWidget

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
